data.title: Pediatricians, nurse practitioners and child psychologists.
data.meta_description: Pediatric Associates has a dedicated team experienced pediatricians, obstetricians, nurse practitioners, and child psychologists who serve families in Kansas City from our Plaza location, as well as families in Lee's Summit, and families in Johnson County from our new office in South Overland Park.
data.text:
Biography:

I graduated from Rockhurst University with a degree in Chemistry and Philosophy. From there, I attended the University of Missouri in Columbia and obtained my medical degree. I served there for residency and finished in 1986 as the Chief Resident for Pediatrics. My wife and I have four sons, all of whom attended Mizzou. Three are now also physicians.

I have been privileged to work with my group for more than thirty years. I am a legacy! Dr. Don Blim, a founder of our group, was my pediatrician. I currently serve as the group's president.

I am very involved with quality initiatives at St. Luke's and at Children's Mercy hospitals. I currently chair or am a member of several committees that focus on quality enhancement of health care delivery for all children in the Kansas City area. I am an original board member for The Children's Health Network of Kansas City.

Over the years I have also been happily involved with the Boy Scouts of America, United States Swim, and various charitable and church-based groups.

I love pediatrics and being allowed to follow a child's growth and development from birth through the college years. I look forward to getting to know new families.

Patient Review:

"Dr. Moylan is an outstanding doctor. He remembers details about my kids and puts them at ease. Highly recommended."

- Katie

Make an appointment with Dr. Moylan at our Plaza (816-561-8100) or Lee's Summit offices (816-554-3646).

Location + Hours

Biography:

As a pediatrician, I strive to be an advocate for children, support parents navigating their parenting journey and to be a mentor as kids transition into young adults. As a parent myself, I understand the importance of caregivers' insight when it comes to medical decisions, as you know your child best! I stay up to date on the latest guidelines and practices in pediatrics. I love primary care because I enjoy helping families adopt healthy lifestyle habits. This includes focusing on activity and nutrition, learning and behavior, and supporting mental health in order to help kids become healthy and happy adults.

About me: I grew up local to the Kansas City area and am lucky to still have a large extended family living nearby. I attended Tulane University for undergrad, KU for medical school and trained at Children's Mercy for residency. I enjoy being outside, yoga, running, reading, and spending time with my friends and family including my husband, our German Shepard mix and our beautiful baby boy!

Make an appointment with Dr. Kantor at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Quote:

"Pediatrics means caring for the whole family. I take the extra time with parents to help them understand the newborn, toddlers, young children and teenagers as they continue to grow and develop. I also strive to make sure parents are comfortable with our medical care."

Biography:

Dr. Woody is from KCMO and graduated from University of Missouri at Kansas City School Medicine in 1994. She completed a pediatric residency at Children's Mercy Hospital in 1997.

Dr. Woody has been with Pediatric Associates since April 1998. She comes from a family of physicians, dentists, teachers, and nurses. She married a physician, and they have two children. They both know the importance of having good communication with your physician.Â

She stays active with hiking, biking, meditation, and reading.Â Dr. Woody and her husband help out in working on bike trails in the Kansas City area year-round. They hope everyone gets out to stay active!

Patient Review:

"We love all the staff we've met at Pediatric Associates and would not take our little guy anywhere else!"

- Kasha

Make an appointment with Dr. Woody at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certification: American Academy of Pediatrics

Undergraduate degree: BS from Stanford University

Medical school: University of Kansas

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital

Quote:

"I believe that my passion for family and wellness are what make me an effective pediatrician."

Biography:

I owe my desire to study medicine to my father. Growing up, I witnessed first-hand how meaningful his medical practice was to him. It was the energy and vibrancy of children that drew me into the specific field of pediatrics. That choice is reaffirmed daily in the exam room! I enjoy every age and developmental stage of children, and partnering with parents in the care of their child brings me so much joy.

My medical journey began as a pre-med student at Stanford University. After graduating with my bachelors, I attended medical school at the University of Kansas. Children's Mercy Hospital is where I began my pediatric journey, and it was there that I was recognized for excellence in primary care as a resident physician. Today, I give back to the residency program by mentoring residents in my clinic.

I feel fortunate to call myself a wife, mother, and physician. I am the wife of a family medicine physician who shares my enthusiasm for fitness and the outdoors; I am the mother of three adult children. Among many interests, I enjoy CrossFit, open-water swimming, challenging hikes and skiing, and I am an avid reader who enjoys a great thriller.

Patient Review:

"Dr. Ehly's focus on preventative healthy and preparing babes for a bright, healthy future is contagious."

- Amber

Make an appointment with Dr. Ehly at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certified Pediatrician by American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate: Bachelor of Science University of Nebraska - Lincoln

Medical School: University of Nebraska Medical Center, Omaha NE

Residency: Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center, Cincinnati OH

Quote:

"From its beginning, Pediatric Associates has been a community leader in pediatric health care. I am honored to be part of this rich history and excited to be involved in its future."

Biography:

When my AP Biology teacher in Omaha, Nebraska asked me what I wanted to do when I grew up, the answer was easy. I told him I wanted to teach. His eyes were soft and suggesting, when he replied, "Yes, you would be a fine teacher. Have you ever thought about teaching medicine? You have quite the knack for science."

That simple quip opened my mind to possibilities. At the University of Nebraska-Lincoln, I poured into my studies with a new goal. I fought for opportunities and experiences that I would have otherwise missed. And less than a decade later, I had reached the goal that he had sparked when I graduated from the University of Nebraska Medical Center.

I learned how to be a pediatrician at Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center. My attending physicians instilled the importance of relationships and teamwork while caring for children. I was able to learn about each patient family, honoring them as individuals while offering state of the art medical treatments. I was inspired by children fighting through hardship and ready to celebrate when healing came. Pediatric is indeed is a remarkable job.

Today, I share evidenced-based child expertise blended with clinical experience. I do this in the office during my time in clinical care, but also using various digital and traditional media outlets to promote child health and wellness.

I have been able to work in science communication through my role as National Spokesperson for the American Academy of Pediatrics and a member of the Council of Communications and Media for the AAP. I am a regular contributor to NBC Learn's Parent Tool Kit, US News and World Report, and our local KCUR. I am passionate about vaccinations for our community's children and serve on Missouri's Advisory Committee for Childhood Immunizations. I am also a nationally recognized speaker in health innovation, health care social media, vaccine advocacy, and media use with children.

I am fueled by my husband, Dr. Kevin, and our two dynamic kids. As a family, we love to travel and share new adventures. Kevin and I also like to golf and are in a couples league in the spring and summer. And in my second life, I would be a race car driver. I love to watch Formula 1 racing and have taken sport driving classes across the Country.

If I'm not in the office, find me at KCKidsDoc.com, Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. I look forward to meeting your family soon.

Patient Review:

"She is wonderful with our girls. She never makes you feel rushed and gives you the attention you need. We love her!"

- Nicky

Make an appointment with Dr. Burgert at our South Overland Park office. Call or text us: (913) 814-8500.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certified Pediatrician by American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate: Bachelor of Science Wayne State College, Wayne NE

Medical School: University of Nebraska Medical Center, Omaha NE

Residency: Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center, Cincinnati OH

Quote:

"There is no greater joy than to see a new life begin and a new family form. And no greater honor than to be entrusted with the health and wellness of both."

Biography:

My journey to pediatrics is one that came full circle.

I grew up in a community of 70 people in southeast Nebraska and am one in the last generation to attend a country schoolhouse; grades K-8th, three teachers and 30 children. It was a unique experience and spoke toward my family's heritage of farming, hard work, pride in community and love of family.

In high school, I was able to see a surgical operation at the local hospital. I was hooked. I knew at that moment -- medicine was what I wanted to do with the rest of my life.

From there I went to college and was able to play college basketball. I then moved on to the University of Nebraska Medical Center where I fell in love with my wife Natasha and the profession of Pediatrics. We married after graduation and then moved to Cincinnati Ohio to further our skills in pediatrics at Cincinnati Children's Medical Hospital.Â

Once our three-year residency was complete, we moved to Kansas City to be closer to family and to start our careers. I found myself at Pediatric Associates, being hired by the brother of my teacher from that small country schoolhouse. At that moment, I knew I was where I was supposed to be, and we (both Natasha and I) have both been at Pediatric Associates ever since.

Natasha and I now have a family of our own, including our two children and 1 French bulldog. As a family we enjoy traveling, exploring the world around us and going on adventures together. In my free time, I continue to play basketball, practice photography and enjoy SCUBA diving.

I love my job as a pediatrician, our community, and this practice. I look forward to meeting you.

Patient Review:

"I respect and appreciate Dr. Kevin's style which has been helpful in getting our children to eat, sleep, and behave well. When we were first time parents, he put us at ease. We can't stay enough positive stuff!"

- Monique

Make an appointment with Dr. Burgert at our South Overland Park office. Call or text us: (913) 814-8500.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certification: American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate Degree: Rockhurst University

Medical School: Kansas City University

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital

Quote:

"My goal as a pediatrician is to promote health and happiness, prevent illness when possible (go vaccines!) and treat my patients with evidenced-based care while considering the whole person and family as they grow."

Biography:

I joined Pediatric Associates in 2014. I love that my job allows me to know and work with such wonderful patients and families. Every child is different, and those differences are part of what makes my job so interesting and rewarding! I aim to promote healthy lifestyles and prevent illness as a child grows. Topics you will hear me focus on include pediatric nutrition, sleep and behavior. I strongly recommend the CDC vaccination schedule as part of my preventive care for my patients and our community.

I grew up in northeast Kansas in a large family. I have lived in Kansas City since moving here to attend Rockhurst University for my undergraduate education. I graduated from KCU medical school and completed residency at Children's Mercy Hospital.

My husband, Michael, and I have 3 amazing kids (two girls and a boy). The happy chaos of having children continues to make me a better pediatrician every day! Outside of work and family, I love to cook, be outdoors, travel, and cheer on our local sports teams, especially the Chiefs!

Patient Review:

"We love all the staff we've met at Pediatric Associates and would not take our little guy anywhere else!"

- Kasha

Make an appointment with Dr. Ragsdale at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certification: American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate: BS in Biology and MS in Kinesiology - Kansas State University

Medical School: DO - Des Moines University

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital

Quote:

"Caring for children is an absolute privilege. My approach to care involves teaming up with parents to promote health and wellness at every stage. I strive for good communication and strong relationships as I empower families with medical knowledge to make the best decisions possible."

Biography:

As a Kansas City native, I couldn't be happier to be a pediatrician in the city I love and call home. After graduating from high school in the area, I attended Kansas State University. I went on to medical school at Des Moines University followed by pediatric residency at Children's Mercy Hospital. I completed an additional year as chief resident before starting at Pediatric Associates in 2016.

There are countless reasons why I love pediatrics, but it comes down to forming relationships and providing care through each stage of development. My role allows me to celebrate with families during times of wellness, but also be available during times of need. I think it's important to stay up-to-date with ever-evolving medical advancements and relay this information to my patients. In general, I focus quite a bit on preventative medicine, and I enjoy caring for children and teenagers with asthma and allergies.

My husband, Brett, and I are lucky parents of three daughters. In addition to keeping us on our toes, we learn something new from our girls everyday. Parenting is such a gift! In my free time, you will find me enjoying the outdoors, exploring Kansas City, traveling, running, cooking, and cheering on the K-State Wildcats!

Patient Review:

"As a new mom, Dr. Robben is very kind and patient. She truly cares about my daughter."

- Sarah

Make an appointment with Dr. Robben at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certification: American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate Degree: Creighton University

Medical School: Rocky Vista University College of Osteopathic Medicine

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital

Quote:

"I am humbled every day by the families who choose me to provide medical care for their children. I will continue to strive to optimize both the physical and mental health of all my patients, in a fun and relaxing environment."

Biography:

I grew up in a small town in northwest Iowa, where a sense of community was highly valued. After completing my medical education and training, I desired to practice in a setting where physicians, medical staff, families, and patients worked together to both optimize their health and that of the community around them. I found Pediatric Associates and the Kansas City metro area to be that place!

I graduated from Creighton University with a degree in Exercise Science. During my studies, I learned the importance of promoting and achieving healthy lifestyles. I attended medical school at Rocky Vista University College of Osteopathic Medicine in Parker, Colorado and was excited to return to the Midwest to complete my residency training at Children's Mercy Hospital.

The most significant part of being a pediatrician is getting to be a small part of helping families grow and thrive while maintaining a calming presence for them when questions or illnesses arise. I strive to keep up on the latest evidence and research but value the personal insight that families bring to their visits. I genuinely believe that I have the best, and most fun, job! I am always amazed at the resiliency of children.

In our free time, my husband and I enjoy traveling, working on home projects, playing with our dog, and cooking. We look forward to starting our own family. I also have a passion for global health and have been fortunate to spend time in multiple countries providing medical care. I aspire to continue my involvement in global health at both the local and international levels.

Patient Review:

"We love Dr. Linz! She is incredibly knowledgeable and is incredible with our son. I would definitely recommend her to any parent."

- Stefanie

Make an appointment with Dr. Linz at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Quote:

"As your child's pediatrician, my goal is to provide the perfect balance of guidance and reassurance to help your child thrive on their journey towards becoming a happy and healthy young adult."

Biography:

I have been fortunate to call Kansas City home since middle school. Both my undergraduate and medical degrees are from the University of Kansas. I joined Pediatric Associates in 2018 after completing my residency training at Children's Mercy Hospital.

I genuinely love being a pediatrician and appreciate the opportunity to educate patients and families. Taking care of kids gives me complete joy, and I always attempt to return the favor by incorporating enthusiasm and humor into each visit. While I pride myself on being a well-rounded pediatrician, I have a particular interest in allergies, asthma, mental health, development, and sports medicine. I serve as a medical volunteer for a week each summer at a camp for children with cancer.

My wife, Emily, is a school psychologist at a local school. Emily and I love serving the community that we grew up in. We have a son who brings us immense happiness every day and he certainly has made me a better pediatrician. Together, we enjoy being in the company of friends and family, attending local sporting events, playing golf, sampling KC cuisine and traveling.

Education:

Board Certification: American Board of Pediatrics

Patient Review:

"You can tell Dr. Demo has a passion for pediatrics. He's easy to talk to and answers all our questions."

- Kasha

Make an appointment with Dr. Demo at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certification: American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate degree:Â B.S. - Texas Christian University, Fort Worth, TX

Medical school:Â M.D. â St. Louis University School of Medicine, St. Louis, MO

Pediatric Residency:Â Rainbow Babies and Children's Hospital, University Hospitals of Cleveland, Cleveland, OH

Quote:

"What I love most about Pediatrics is the opportunity to get to know my patients and their families. It is such a joy to watch them grow up and manage the ups and downs of their health and development. My care philosophy is to listen first, understanding that each family is unique and each child's needs are different."

Biography:

I grew up in Dickinson, North Dakota and have always been drawn to working with children. By the time I got to college, I was considering a career in medicine, and my experience as a volunteer at a children's hospital solidified my decision to become a pediatrician. To this day, I love the sheer joy and resilience of kids, even when ill. I finished my undergraduate degree at Texas Christian University, then went on to medical school at St. Louis University.Â I completed my pediatrics residency at Rainbow Babies and Children's Hospital in Cleveland, OH.

I was in private practice in Michigan before settling in the Kansas City area in 2011. My husband is also a physician, so we share a chaotic and adventurous life with our three wonderful children. I enjoy the great outdoors and love to visit National Parks any chance I can get. I am a big advocate for personal fitness and a healthy lifestyle and try to incorporate that into my own life as much as possible. I love attending sporting events, musical theater, and listening to podcasts while walking our dog, a fabulous Goldendoodle named "Cubby."Â

I feel fortunate to work at Pediatric Associates because I am part of a great team. We are dedicated to providing the best possible care to our patients, and we look forward to being advocates and partners in your child's health.

Patient Review:

"She is a compassionate doctor who has her patient's best interest at hand. She listens to my concerns and takes them into consideration when providing them medical care. I'm thankful to have her looking after my kids."

- Sonya

Make an appointment with Dr. Hulsing at our Lee's Summit offices. Contact us by phone at (816) 554-3646.

Location + Hours

Licensure:

Missouri, Division of Professional Registration

Kansas, Behavioral Sciences Regulatory Board

Education:

Ph.D. -University of Kansas, Lawrence, Kansas

Internship & Post-Doctoral Fellowship

Clinical Child Psychology (APA Accredited), Children's Mercy Hospital,

Kansas City, Missouri.

Care Philosophy:

"Teaching kids and parents tools to cope and grow so they become healthier/better versions of themselves and as a family brings me so much joy. I feel lucky and blessed to be in a position to help so many wonderful families."

Biography:

Dr. McConahay is a licensed child and adolescent psychologist who provides evidence-based assessment and cognitive-behavioral interventions. She was the first child psychologist to join a pediatric practice in the Kanas City metropolitan area and finds working in a patient-centered home that supports both physical and psychological well-being through a comprehensive care approach improves quality of patient care.Â

She enjoys working with ages varying from infant through 21 years old treating common behavior problems in addition to psychological issues of childhood and adolescence. In addition to direct care with children, she provides parenting consultations to empower parents to become more confident in their skills as a leader of their family. The variety of issues and ages she treats in her clinic are part of what she finds exciting and fulfilling. She loves when families return to see her for a different problem or child so she can build on the trusting relationship she has developed with the family.

Raised in Leawood, Kansas, Dr. McConahay returned home for graduate school after college at the University of Arizona. She enjoys the family values of Kansas City and the change of seasons. Outside of work, she is a wife and mother to two sons. Her favorite thing is when the family spends time together wakeboarding on their boat at the lake. In her free time, she enjoys running, traveling and relaxing in general with friends.

Patient Review:

"We love all the staff we've met at Pediatric Associates and would not take our little guy anywhere else!"

- Kasha

Make an appointment with Kathy McConahay at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Licensure:

Missouri, Division of Professional Registration

Kansas, Behavioral Sciences Regulatory Board

Education:

Ph.D. - University of Nevada, Las Vegas

Internship & Post-Doctoral Fellowship Pediatric Psychology (APA Accredited), Children's Mercy Hospital, Kansas City, Missouri.

Biography:

Dr. Fornander is a licensed child and adolescent psychologist who provides evidence-based psychological evaluations and therapy services. She sees patients from infants through young adults treating psychological and behavioral concerns. Dr. Fornander loves the opportunity to treat a wide range of concerns across different ages. She enjoys helping parents gain confidence in their parenting and supporting them in advocating for their child's needs, especially at school.

Dr. Fornander is also an active researcher and primarily focuses on the unique health and emotional needs of transgender/gender-diverse patients and pediatric patients with cancer, hereditary cancer syndromes, and weight management concerns. Dr. Fornander is also passionate about teaching and mentoring future leaders in the field. She teaches undergraduate courses at multiple universities and has lectured and presented numerous training seminars and workshops.

Dr. Fornander is originally from central Nebraska and moved to Las Vegas, NV, for her graduate training. Her family is happy to have returned home to the Midwest to plant some long-term roots. When she isn't working, Dr. Fornander can be found chasing her young daughter and two pups around the house or at local parks or hiking trails. Her family loves to explore all that the KC area has to offer. Dr. Fornander's ideal day would be spent reading a book, on an ocean beach, and sipping coffee, but since that rarely happens, she also enjoys traveling, baking, trying new restaurants, attempting DIY home projects, playing games, watching Golden Knights hockey, and spending time with her family.

Make an appointment with Mirae J. Fornander at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Board Certification:

Pediatric Nursing Certification Board

Education:

Undergraduate Degree: William Jewell College

Masters Degree: Stony Brook University/ University Texas at El Paso

Quote:

"As a former NICU Nurse, I understand the worries and concerns that come with parenting. I hope to provide guidance, reassurance and education to help your child grow and thrive."

Biography:

As a former patient of Dr. Waters, I am thrilled to be working at Pediatric Associates as a Pediatric Nurse Practitioner (PNP). I received my Bachelor of Science in Nursing from William Jewell College and my Masters in Perinatal Women's Health from Stony Brook University in Long Island, NY. After working several years in the NICU and Mother/Baby at Saint Luke's Health System, I obtained my post master's degree in Pediatric Primary Care from the University of Texas at El Paso.

Outside of work, I am an active member of Junior League of Kansas City, a volunteer with the Happy Bottoms Diaper Bank. I also enjoy volunteering as a child passenger safety technician, making sure each child is buckled up safely!

I love my job as a PNP because I have the opportunity to care for patients with acute and chronic illness, but also in health prevention. Watching children grow is a great pleasure, and creating lasting relationships with families is one of the most rewarding parts of my job!

Patient Review:

"We love all the staff we've met at Pediatric Associates and would not take our little guy anywhere else!"

- Kasha

Make an appointment with Lindsay Kiely at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Board Certification:

Pediatric Nursing Certification Board

Education:

Undergraduate Degree: University of Arkansas - Fayetteville, AR

Masters Degree: University of Missouri-Kansas City School of Nursing

Quote:

"In health and illness, children bring joy to life! I feel honored to serve the pediatric population of Kansas City and witness this firsthand. I hope to make each child's visit fun, helpful and valued."

Biography:

I grew up in Rogers, Arkansas with appreciation for health, science and helping others. I decided to pursue a nursing career at the University of Arkansas and work in pediatrics. After graduation, I worked as a NICU nurse at Children's Mercy in Kansas City. While working in the unit, I learned to appreciate the family unit and caring for those who can't always speak for themselves. When in that nursing role, I realized I deeply enjoyed helping educate families to have the tools to best take care of their children, not just in the hospital setting, but when they go home as well. I decided to go back to school to pursue my master's degree.

During my training, I had the opportunity to work at Pediatric Associates and found a special place in the Kansas City community. I am so excited to be joining the group as a clinician and care for KC's kids. I am married to my husband, Scott, and we hope to start a family of our own. I know becoming a parent myself will help me grow in my knowledge of pediatrics and gain perspective. In my free time I enjoy watching the Chiefs, exercising, going to church, reading and traveling. I look forward to meeting you soon.

Make an appointment at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certification by the American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate Degree:Â Bachelor of Arts in Chemistry from the University of Kansas

Medical School: University of Kansas in Kansas City, KS

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital in Kansas City, MO

Quote:

"What I love about Pediatric Associates is that we maintain excellent access to our group for our patients with our extended hours and multiple clinic locations."

Biography:

I am from Topeka, KS and now live in Overland Park, KS with my youngest daughter and wife. My three older daughters are grown and scattered around the country. I enjoy traveling with my wife, and we have started exploring National Parks in print, online, on TV, and best of all, by visiting. We look forward to expanding this hobby as our time allows. I also enjoy trying to keep up with my daughters in person and by phone. Outside of these favorites, I have a strange set of interests â Star Trek, Star Wars, MCU (Marvel Cinematic Universe), International Harvester toy tractors, and tinkering on house repairs.

Patient Review:

"Dr. Kasper is very thorough and listens to my concerns. I've never left the office without an action plan in place."

- Brea

Make an appointment with Dr. Kasper at our Lee's Summit office. Contact us by phone at (816) 554-3646.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certification: American Academy of Pediatrics

Undergraduate: Bachelor of Science in Biology, Union University in Jackson, TN

Medical School: University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital, Kansas City, MO.

Quote:

"I love being a Pediatrician because I get to watch children grow from infancy into young adulthood. Every age brings such unique joys and challenges. I also love getting to know the entire family and journeying through life with them."

Biography:

I'm proud to have grown up in a small town in Arkansas. After completing my undergraduate work and obtaining my medical degree, my husband and I moved to Kansas City. We quickly fell in love with the small town feel of KC, its food, its sports teams, and of course, the kind people.

I joined Pediatric Associates in 2014 and enjoy seeing patients from birth through high school. I love watching the children I care for as they grow into the young adults they will become. Each age comes with its unique blessings and challenges, and I enjoy helping families navigate these stages. I have a particular interest in preventative medicine, mental health, and teen health.

Outside of work, I enjoy traveling, reading, and trying new recipes. My husband and I met working at a children's summer camp in college, and we have been together ever since. He serves as the Senior Pastor at our church. We also have two daughters who keep us busy and continue to make me a better Pediatrician. On Saturdays in the fall, you can find our family cheering on the Alabama football team. Roll Tide!

Patient Review:

"We love all the staff we've met at Pediatric Associates and would not take our little guy anywhere else!"

- Kasha

Make an appointment with Dr. McDaniel at our Lee's Summit office. Contact us by phone at (816) 554-3646.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certification: American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate Degree: University of Missouri Columbia

Medical School: University of Missouri Columbia

Residency: University of Missouri Columbia

Adolescent Medicine Fellowship: Rainbow Children's Cleveland OH

Quote:

"I have been in practice for over twenty years at Pediatric Associates. What a joy to watch my patients grow from infancy to young adults!"

Biography:

I attended the University of Missouri - Columbia for undergraduate and medical school.

I completed my pediatric residency at the University of Missouri â Columbia, as well as an extra two years of fellowship training in Adolescent Medicine at Rainbow Children's Hospital in Cleveland, OH.

I have practiced pediatrics for more than 20 years at Pediatric Associates.

My husband and I live in Lee's Summit. We have three children, all of whom attended Lees Summit schools.

In my free time, I enjoy spending time with my family, traveling, cooking, gardening, hiking, and reading.

Patient Review:

"We love all the staff we've met at Pediatric Associates and would not take our little guy anywhere else!"

- Kasha

Make an appointment with Dr. Williams at our Lee's Summit office. Contact us by phone at (816) 554-3646.

Location + Hours

Board Certification:

Pediatric Nursing Certification Board

Education:

Bachelor of Science in Nursing: University of Missouri- Columbia, MO

Master's Degree in Nursing: Maryville University - St. Louis, MO

Biography:

I was born and raised in Kansas City and am so happy to call it my home!

I have always been interested in health and medicine and knew from an early age that I wanted to be a nurse. I find so much joy in working with kids each day.

I obtained my bachelor's degree from the University of Missouri in 2011. After six years of working in the Intensive Care Unit at Children's Mercy Hospital, I decided I wanted to further my education and become a pediatric nurse practitioner to work with children of all ages. I obtained my master's degree in nursing from Maryville University in St. Louis, MO in 2018 and started working at Pediatric Associates right after graduation.

My husband and I have one daughter, Emma. In my free time, I enjoy spending time with my family and friends, playing golf, reading, and traveling.

Patient Review:

"We love all the staff we've met at Pediatric Associates and would not take our little guy anywhere else!"

- Kasha

Make an appointment with Andrea MacKay at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certification: American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate degree: University of Missouri

Medical school: Kansas City University of Medicine and Biosciences

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital

Quote:

"I am thrilled to serve as a pediatrician and look forward to caring for the future generations of children in the community where I grew up."

Biography:

I am a Kansas City native and grew up as a Pediatric Associates patient. If you have ever seen Dr. Chuck Moylan at the office, you may have even heard a story or two about me growing up!

I graduated from the University of Missouri with a degree in biochemistry. I went on to earn my medical degree from Kansas City University of Medicine and Biosciences (KCU). I graduated from KCU in 2017 and completed my pediatric residency at Children's Mercy Hospital.

Growing up I was active in competitive swimming and Boy Scouts where I earned the rank of Eagle Scout. Today my hobbies include cooking, traveling, snow skiing, and all things related to space. My wife and I have two young daughters and I love spending time playing with them and learning about everything they are interested in as well.

Make an appointment with Dr. Alan Moylan at our Plaza (816-561-8100) or Lee's Summit offices (816-554-3646).

Education:

Board Certification: American Academy of Nurse Practitioners

Bachelor of Science in Nursing: Austin Peay State University, Clarksville, TN

Quote:

"As a mom, a former pediatric nurse, and now a Nurse Practitioner, I am truly honored to care for your kids! My ultimate goal is to provide effective education to parents and families and ensure confidence in my patients' care."

Biography:

Pediatrics has always been my passion! From a young age, I knew I wanted to help people and there is no better way than to do that through being a Nurse Practitioner at Pediatric Associates! I love the relationship I get to form with each patient and family, and I love watching kids grow! Caring for pediatric patients means caring for the whole patient as well as their family. I am truly honored to do that at Pediatric Associates.

I got my nursing degree from Austin Peay State University and ran track there. I didn't have much free time to say the least! My husband and I got married and moved to Kansas City in 2015. That is when I began working Pediatric Nurse and then as a Neonatal ICU nurse. The drive to want to help people pushed me to go back to school and become a Nurse Practitioner.

Outside of being a Nurse Practitioner, you can find me chasing my toddler around, drinking coffee, working out, and spending time with my family! I enjoy hiking, being outdoors, and reading. I am involved in my local church and volunteer at various organizations through church. My husband and I love to travel different places with our family. We also love cheering on our local KC teams!

Make an appointment with Natalie Norville at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Quote:

"To be entrusted with the care of a child â there is no greater honor and privilege."

Biography:

I was born and raised in a small town in Nebraska. I moved to Lincoln to attend Nebraska Wesleyan University where I played volleyball and ran track while completing my undergraduate studies. I obtained my medical degree at the University of Nebraska Medical Center in Omaha and then moved to Kansas City for my pediatric residency at Children's Mercy Hospital. I am thrilled to call Kansas City home and am honored to serve the children and community through Pediatric Associates!

In junior-high a teacher had us write a letter to our future selves, one which I opened 15 years later at my 10-year high school reunion. Even then, I knew I wanted to be a pediatrician and spend my life caring for kids. I truly love all aspects of pediatrics but really have a passion for preventative care, development, healthy sleep habits, and nutrition. I enjoy helping families navigate the challenges and joys of parenthood; working along-side parents and empowering them to raise happy and healthy children. I strive to build deep relationships with patients and their families and I take great pride in that responsibility.

When not in the office, you can find me spending time with my family. My husband, Teemu, and I have been blessed with two wonderful children who keep us very busy. As a family we enjoy spending time outdoors, staying active, cheering on the Chiefs, traveling both domestically and abroad and being with our family and friends.

Make an appointment with Dr. Allee Tiitinen at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Education:

Undergraduate degree: Truman State University, Kirksville, Missouri 2005

Medical school: The University of Minnesota Medical School, Minneapolis, Minnesota 2009

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital, Kansas City, Missouri 2012

Board certification: American Board of Pediatrics 2012

Biography:

Growing up, my parents encouraged me to pursue any and every dream I could imagine. They provided me with ample opportunities in academics, fine arts, and athletics. I quickly learned that I loved sports and learning how the body functioned, excelled, and healed. I combined these interests as a dual sport athlete in college while obtaining a degree in exercise science to prepare me for medical school.

I met my husband during medical school in my home state of Minnesota, and after graduation we traveled south to Kansas City on a whim for residency training. We quickly fell in LOVE with KC! From the restaurants to the sports teams (although I will always cheer first for my Minnesota Vikings!) and the weather to the neighborly community, we feel so extremely fortunate to now call Kansas City home to our family of six.

I was also introduced to Pediatric Associates during my residency training as Dr. Natasha was my teacher and mentor in general pediatrics for three years. During my years at PA, I learned how to take evidence-based science and medicine, mix in empathy and compassion for children, and come out with the best and most fulfilling way to take care for pediatric patients. Now, after a not-so brief 10-year stint at Children's Mercy in the emergency department, I am proud and excited to be returning to Pediatric Associates to care for children during their ill visits.

Make an appointment with Dr. Calie Donohue at our South Overland Park office. Call or text us: (913) 814-8500

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certification: American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate degree: Iowa State University

Medical school: University of Kansas

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital

Biography:

From my days as an editor of my high school newspaper, I've enjoyed putting pen to paper and watching new stories unfold. In college I earned my journalism degree while participating as captain of the Iowa State University swim team, before diving straight into a career in magazine publishing. It wasn't until I was working in a small hospital in Iowa that I realized I didn't just want to write stories about the health care experience--I wanted to be in them!

I moved back to Kansas City to complete medical school at the University of Kansas. During my pediatric residency at Children's Mercy Hospital, I had the chance to spend time at Pediatric Associates, where a fire ignited in me to make this place my "forever" practice. I am constantly impressed by the strong relationships built between providers and families, and how this synergy creates an environment where children and adolescents truly blossom into amazing young adults.

In my free time you'll find me playing yard games with my husband while my children chase each other around the neighborhood, cheering on the Kansas City Chiefs or chowing down on food from my favorite local restaurants. I am nothing without my morning cup of coffee, celebrity memoirs are my guilty pleasure, and I love a good pair of sweatpants and back porch sitting in the fall.

I am thrilled to be practicing medicine in the same community where I was raised, and where my husband, two daughters and I have planted strong roots. I look forward to meeting your family and watching your children's stories unfold!

Make an appointment with Dr. Maddie Summers at our South Overland Park office. Call or text us: (913) 814-8500

Location + Hours

Quote:

"An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure." â Benjamin Franklin

Education:

Board Certification: American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate degree: University of Kansas

Medical school: University of Kansas School of Medicine

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital

Biography:

Dr. Isaacson's journey to pediatrics was driven by a passion, inherited from his mother, for human physiology and the desire to harness the curative powers of medicine. During his medical training, it was only fitting that Dr. Isaacson was drawn to pediatrics, a field valuing preventative care.

Dr. Isaacson takes a minimalist approach to pediatric care, believing the human body is extraordinary and prefers to stay out of its way. When intervention is necessary, he is committed to a heartfelt approach and joint decision-making. He is prudent with the use of antibiotics and firmly adheres to the CDC vaccine schedule.

Beyond medicine, Dr. Isaacson's family fills his cup. Together with his wife Courtney, he has three beautiful young daughters, Penelope, Olive, and Charlotte. The Isaacsons are Kansas City natives who enjoy staying active as a family and sneaking off to the beach any chance they get.

Dr. Isaacson looks forward to meeting you and being an active guide in your child's healthcare journey.

Make an appointment with Dr. Isaacson at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Quote:

"My approach to pediatrics is rooted in empathy, open communication, and a genuine love for children. As your partner in the incredible adventure of parenthood, I am here to listen, educate, and provide the guidance you need to make informed decisions about your child's health."

Education:

Undergraduate degree: Boston College

Medical school: Medical College of Wisconsin

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital

I strongly recommend fully vaccinating kids against preventable diseases on the schedule approved by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), the Advisory Committee on Immunized Practices (ACIP), and the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP).

Biography:

I grew up in a small town in Wisconsin where I was inspired by my parents' dedication to medicine as physicians rooted in the community. They always described their work as the privilege of building relationships with patients during both the happiest and the toughest moments of their lives. Medicine is about human connection; that is what inspired me to follow in their footsteps and pursue a career in pediatrics.

After graduating from Boston College with a degree in Biology, I returned to Wisconsin to attend the Medical College of Wisconsin. There I met my husband Ron, and then subsequently moved to Kansas City for residency at Children's Mercy Hospital. Living in Kansas City, we fell in love with the people, the food, and, of course, the Chiefs.

We are lucky to be calling Kansas City our home, as we grow our family and are now experiencing the city in a new light with our son, Everett, who keeps us busy! As a family, we love outdoor adventures with our pup, staying on top of the ever-evolving restaurant scene, and traveling as much as time allows.

I chose to become a pediatrician because I love the innocence and curiosity of children. I enjoy building long-lasting relationships with my patients and their families from birth through adolescence. I firmly believe that caring for a child goes beyond addressing physical ailments and involves understanding their emotional well-being as well as supporting their cognitive growth. I am here to provide guidance to parents with a focus on early intervention, preventative care, and open communication.

I would be honored to partner with you on this incredible journey of raising healthy, resilient, and joyful kids.

Make an appointment with Dr. Palmen at our Plaza office. Contact us by phone at (816) 561-8100.

Location + Hours

Education:

Board Certification: American Board of Pediatrics

Undergraduate degree: University of Missouri Kansas City

Medical school: University of Missouri Kansas City

Residency: Children's Mercy Hospital

Biography:

I knew I wanted to become a doctor from a young age since I was always fascinated by the sciences. But it was watching my doctor stitch up a cut that convinced me that medicine was the coolest profession. This led me to pursue UMKC's accelerated program where I completed both my undergraduate and medical degrees. After my first rotation in pediatrics, I knew this was the right career for me. I completed my pediatric residency at Children's Mercy Hospital.

Since then, I have been a practicing pediatrician in the KC metro area, but when the opportunity to practice in my community arose I jumped at the opportunity to join this amazing practice in 2023. I enjoy taking care of kids of all ages as well as getting to know their families as a whole. I love being a support to help parents navigate the difficulties of raising happy, healthy kids. I believe in shared decision making and finding a treatment plan that works for your family when possible. I have a passion for childhood safety and building healthy habits in childhood that will lead to healthier adults.

In my free time, I enjoy exploring the outdoors including hiking, biking, and traveling. I enjoy cooking, baking, reading, and cheering on our local sports teams. I am the mom of two little boys who keep me busy with sports, legos and all things outdoors. My husband and I have called Lee's Summit home most of our adult lives. I am so excited to now be working in the community we call home.

Make an appointment with Dr. Wiemann at our Lee's Summit offices (816-554-3646).
